On December 12, 2017, a correction was made to the scalar factor for the entire table. The data were meant to be published in thousands of dollars (dollars x 1000) and not in dollars.
Figures may not add up to total due to rounding.

2017 estimates contained in this table have been assigned a letter value to indicate the quality of the estimate, as measured by the coefficient of variation (expressed as a percentage). A = excellent (0.00% to 4.99%), B = very good (5.00% to 9.99%), C = good (10.00% to 14.99%), D = acceptable (15.00% to 24.99%), E = use with caution (25.00% to 49.99%). 

As of 2018, estimates contained in this table have been assigned a letter value (A to F) to indicate the quality of the estimate, as provided by the combination of the coefficient of variation and the non-response rate.
On December 12, 2017, a correction was made to the scalar factor for the entire table. The data were meant to be published in thousands of dollars (dollars x 1000) and not in dollars.
